What is the purpose of using a chiral ionic liquid in the synthesis?
data.answer: To induce chirality in the resulting solid

data.question: How is the homochirality of SIMOF-1 proven?
data.answer: Through 10 high-quality single-crystal X-ray determinations showing the same absolute structure

data.question: What happens when the chiral component of the ionic liquid is not included in the synthesis?
data.answer: An achiral compound, SIMOF-2, is formed

data.question: What is the role of the ionic liquid in ionothermal synthesis?
data.answer: It acts as solvent and structure directing agent

data.question: What is the significance of the Flack parameter in crystal structure determination?
data.answer: It indicates whether the structure under study has the correct absolute structure

data.question: Is the ionic liquid cation removed from the pores of SIMOF-1 during synthesis?
data.answer: No, it is strongly held inside the pores and cannot be removed without causing the structure to collapse

data.question: Does the synthesis of SIMOF-1 require a chiral center in the building units?
data.answer: No, it is synthesized from nonchiral building blocks
